intro: Cryptantha virgata, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Its seed pods are slender and cylindrical, containing several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Cryptantha virgata is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
